todo: Disability Support Pension Partner Allowance or Widow Allowance

service.name: Widow Allowance
service.description: Widow Allowance (WA) was introduced to provide an income support option for older women who had lost the support of a partner (through death, divorce or separation) and who had no recent workforce experience. WA will be phased out from 1 July 2005 with new grants from this date only to be made to women who were born on or before 1 July 1955.

Dimension.name: People with disability
Dimension.desc: We provide payments and services to help you if you have an illness, injury or a disability that means you cannot work, or can only do a limited amount of work.

Dimension.name: Centrelink
Dimension.desc: Delivering a range of payments and services for people at times of major change.

Dimension.name: Human Services
Dimension.desc: We deliver social and health-related payments and services

subService.name: Utilities Allowance
subService.desc: Utilities Allowance (UA) is paid to certain customers to assist in meeting the cost of regular bills such as gas, electricity and water.
